Hello,
I am trying to carry out a simulation for ethanol hydrogasification. 
The kinetics, transport and thermodynamics data is taken from the 
llnl file which is available in the files section. When I run the 
program I get a warning which I have pasted here:


**** WARNING ****
For species ch2chch2o, discontinuity in cp/R detected at Tmid = 1000
	Value computed using low-temperature polynomial:  18.0127.
	Value computed using high-temperature polynomial: 18.3387.
**** WARNING ****
For species ch2chch2o, discontinuity in h/RT detected at Tmid = 1000
	Value computed using low-temperature polynomial:  21.2183.
	Value computed using high-temperature polynomial: 21.169.


I was still able to carry out the simulation earlier. But now I was 
trying a different program in which I am observing the temperature 
variation and incidently the program gives an error when the 
temperature reaches a value very near 1000K. The error is:


?? 

************************************************
                Cantera Error!                  
************************************************


Procedure: setState_UV
Error:   no convergence. dt = -0.000204342
u = -6.10327e+006 v = 0.185101

Error in ==> c:\cantera154
\matlab\toolbox\cantera\cantera\ctmethods.dll
Error in ==> c:\cantera154
\matlab\toolbox\cantera\cantera\@Reactor\private\reactormethods.m
On line 6  ==>   v = ctmethods(60, n, job, a);  

Error in ==> c:\cantera154
\matlab\toolbox\cantera\cantera\@Reactor\advance.m
On line 22  ==> reactormethods(8, reactor_hndl(r), tout);

Error in ==> C:\Documents and Settings\surinder\My 
Documents\Cantera154\constantpreactor.m
On line 24  ==>     advance(r,t);



Can anyone suggest some remedy for this. I am thinking of finding 
some way to change the ao-a6 coefficients for ch2chch2o minutely 
such that the cp/R and H/RT value at 1000K converges. 

Surinder
